Reviews.Title: “No hot water”
Reviews.Author: natalieviskin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel del corso for two days in april. The location is great, near the spanish steps, but besides that, there is nothing good at this place. The rooms are small, we didn't have hot water in the shower. We asked them to fix it, they tried to but it didn't work, we had to shower in freezing water. The breakfest is very poor, in a small coridor. In our friend's room, the bathroom smelled like cigarettes, their window faced the corridor.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: F0rd_Prefect42
Reviews.Content: Hotel Del Corso is centrally located for easy walking to the major sites in Rome. Our room was small, but nicely furnished and very clean. Staff is very friendly and helpful. When checking out, Cristian even gave us suggestions for our next stop in Florence that were very helpful. Breakfast selections were limited, but the quality was good and the made-to-order cappuccino more than compensated for the limited selection. The area has many restaurants and shopping within a few blocks and felt very safe in the evenings. I definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Okay Location, Poor Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Douglas E
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Del Corso at the end of March in the beautiful city of Rome. And while some things were great, other things not so much. Let me explain: Good: The staff at this hotel was excellent. I can't state this enough because if it weren't for them, this would have been a 1 or 2 star review. Christian, Andrea, and Anna all made the stay better than it would have been. They were helpful with local attractions, with the language and customs and Christian even had a pizza delivered to my room. Anna called several places for us over a period of what must have been several hours, way above and beyond the call of duty. Again, great staff! Okay: The locations is ... busy. Just below the bedroom window was a crowded street. Its kind of like getting a hotel room in a Mall. If this is your thing, then move this up to the good column. Personally, I didn't care for it. Although the windows were a nice noise supressor. As for the proximity to things, sure its close to the Spanish Steps and Trevi Fountain and maybe the Pantheon if you are up to it. But the big things (Colloseum, Vatican, Catacombs) you still need to drive and Del Corso is toward the north part of Rome so the drive will be a little longer. And the room was small but I am keeping this here because most rooms in Rome and Italy for that matter are. Bad: Ok, now for the bad stuff and it is really a shame because this could have been a great experience. The pillows were incredibly thin and uncomfortable. The fridge/cash bar was broken. There were no instructions for the safe. The shower was INCREDIBLY small. Now I am a big guy (6') so adjust for your height but I had difficulty bending over without either hitting my head on the wall or backing into the temperature handle. Scalding or freezing water to follow. This could have been remedied somewhat if they put in a $5 soap tray attached to something. The walls were paper thin and I woke up in the middle of the night to a neighbors snoring. No joke. There was what might have been either a dead bug or a feather on the panel above the bed. There were pubic hairs in the bidet when we checked in. Thankfully cleaned the next day. We were just outside the breakfast area which became very noisy in the morning. Keep this in mind. The included what looked like a 18-inch "TV" high up in the corner of the room. about the same size as the screen on my laptop. And finally, the thing that bothered me the most was the "free internet" that was on maybe 20% of the time and always dropped out at the worst times. So there is my experience in a nutshell. If hotel management addressed those problems, I might go back. If they let go of the people, I definitely won't. Ciao!

Reviews.Title: “Rome's Hidden Gem !”
Reviews.Author: jacquif73
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth visit to Rome and i must say this hotel is by far one of the best in Rome for a number of reasons. The location of this hotel is fantastic and you are so central for all the attractions in Rome. We had a room at the front which overlooks one of the main shopping streets in Rome which was great for people watching at all hours of the day and night. The room was spacious and airy. Everything in it you need. The Hotel is really close to the Spanish steps if you fancy a wee hour sitting in the sun. Restaurants surround the hotel and there is lots and lots of choice, so your not wasting any time looking for somewhere to eat. The staff at the hotel were all lovely, all very friendly and professional. Were always happy to help. The girl in the breakfast room was especially nice, even when she was rushed off her feet. The breakfast in the morning was great and had lots of choice bacon, wee sausages, boiled eggs, croissants, rolls, fruit, cheese and cold ham - everything you could really ask for. Now, if you have been to Rome a few times and done most of the touristy parts and would like a chill i would strongly suggest that you take a few hours of your day to spend on the rooftop terrace. Why? There is a music school somewhere in the streets behind the hotel and every day you can hear the opera singers practising, trumpets, saxophones, pianos being played - it is one of the most wonderful entertaining things i have ever experienced whilst sitting in gorgeous surroundings. I hope you do choose this hotel if you are going to Rome it is definitely one of the BEST.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, excellent location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Peter K
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent central location, on one of the main shopping streets, not far from the Spanish steps. Good spot for getting to any of the key tourist areas. A huge choice of very good restaurants are near by which is great after a tiring day! Our room was spacious and clean, breakfast good and the staff could not have been more helpful. Would have liked a tea/coffee maker in the room but other than that everything was very good. Would definitely recommend. Liz Kitchen

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, nice location”
Reviews.Author: jedypl
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nicely located in the center.. I had a junior suite at the top-floor, which didn't cost much extra. It was spacious, clean, and quiet. The hotel is expensive as are most hotels in Rome. For this money, and in a junior suite, you would expect at least a coffee maker and an ironing kit--but no. Instead: lovely flowers. That's also quite nice. Breakfast is o.k., so in all, I liked to stay here very much.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, lovely rooms, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Nina R
Reviews.Content: I found the Hotel Del Corso right here on TripAdvisor and was completely and absolutely satisfied with my choice. I loved the room, the location was right in the middle of all the best Rome has to offer, and the staff was always available to help and make my stay more comfortable. I truly felt as if I was in my home away from home during my week's stay in Rome. I would highly recommend it to other travelers, as well return on my next visit to the city.

Reviews.Title: “A great holiday in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Sushmeetha S
Reviews.Content: I think the best selling point of this hotel is its Location. You cant compromise on this.Its bang on the shopping street right opposite the Nike Showroom.. It's one long street filled with shops of all kinds cross roads are filled with small Italian restaurants. One end of the street is Piazza del Popolo and the other end is Piazza Venezia the biggest squares in Rome. From Piazza Venzeia the Colosseum is like a 5-8 min walk. The only 2 small negative points is that some rooms are stuffy with no ventilation but we requested to change our room on the 3rd day and with the availability they obliged. and the breakfast room in winter is very small to accommodate many people but in summer they have a roof top which solves the problem. but the staff are very friendly and you could walk to Spanish steps, Trevi fountain and Pantheon in 5-7 mins. Overall It's definitely a good hotel and I recommend it to everyone. Breakfast is good . Loved the fresh coffee.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: maria a
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect!!You are in the heart of town and you can visit a lot of places with the foot(Fontana di trevi, piazza di spagna, piazza del popolo etc).The staff was really friendly.They were willing to offer you their assistance in any situation. The room was nicely decorated and clean.The breakfast was really delicious.It's a very nice hotel and you have to visit it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: Fluffiness4
Reviews.Content: Loved staying in this hotel,  the location is perfect, we were walking all around the historical center, spending the evening at piazza del Popolo, Spagna and Trevi Fountain. The room was clean, elegant and nice. my only complaint is about the shower, balancing the water temperature was difficult and the water flow was very strong.  The breakfast choices were all good especially the cappuccino was amazingly good!   We asked for an airport shuttle that costs 50€ (the airport taxi fare is 40€) but we didn't mind the extra 10 euros for some indulgence, they were right on time with a nice car. I would definitely come back and recommend it to a friend!

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Excellent Service, Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: Amanda M
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a welcoming atmosphere from the moment we stepped into the building (even at 10:30 in the evening!) The staff welcomed us with a smile and helped us up to our room. The rooms are very cozy and nicely decorated! The breakfast in the morning was delicious and every morning we would be warmly greeted by a hotel worker. There was plenty of help provided from the staff to locate the tourist areas as well as hidden gems! Overall this is an excellent hotel - you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Jenny L
Reviews.Content: We visited Rome for the first time in June 2011 and stayed at the Hotel Del Corso, which is right in the middle of all the action on Via Del Corso. Surrounded by plenty of shops, bars and cafes and within walking distance of the Trevi Fountain and Spanish Steps. I had a single room, which was clean, elegant and very comfortable with a lovely ensuite. My uncle and aunt, with whom I travelled had a double room and theirs was roomy equally elegant and clean. The staff were always helpful and obliging, even allowing us into our room before the usual 2 pm checkin. Breakfast offered a variety of different hot and cold foods and was not in a room, but up on the rooftop terrace. When next in Rome, we will go back to the Hotel Del Corso ANYTIME! Great place.

Reviews.Title: “Very bad experience”
Reviews.Author: konstandeena
Reviews.Content: Perfect location and that's all! Straight to the centre. Still it's the worst hotel I've ever visited in my life! Very small, very very very dirty! Bad smell in the room plus it had a window from which you could see the corridor! Very small breakfast room, very poor breakfast. Way too expensive for it's quality. Do not visit!!!

Reviews.Title: “gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: andrew b
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to me by my uncle who had come to Italy this summer, the suggestion was right on this street there are plenty of stores for shopping, close to Piazza del Popolo, the hotel has rooms a little small, but there is everything you need, well decorated in modern style, breakfast is excellent, the choice is varied, the kindness and courtesy are the thing that I liked, I did not know where to dine, I have been recommended go to a nearby restaurant, thank you very much for this advice the Porto di Ripetta restaurant, it was my best meal.

Reviews.Title: “Good location!”
Reviews.Author: atan97
Reviews.Content: Great location right in the main shopping area, close to the Spanish Steps. We could walk from the hotel to all the main sites, including the Vatican City and Colosseum, within 30 minutes. Front desk and breakfast service staff were friendly and helpful. Breakfast spread was decent. We had a room on the second floor facing the main road, which means we could hear the lively street activities. If you're picky about that, you might want to request a quieter room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for shopping and sight-seeing”
Reviews.Author: Esther B
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights here. The air-conditioned room size was spacious, however the bath was somewhat small (especially the shower--you had to keep from bumping its door or else water would get everywhere). The design of the room and bath was stylish and rather upscale, however the bed and pillows were too firm for us. There was a minibar/small fridge. The included breakfast was ample, including eggs, bacon, bread, rolls and pastries, yogurts, cereals, fruit, juices, and tea or coffee. It was also nice to eat that on the rooftop patio. Other than the comfort of the bed, my biggest complaint is that the nice carpet was filthy, especially nearest the room's entrance. I don't think they have ever shampooed it, and it made me wonder if there vac was any good.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay. Excellent staff”
Reviews.Author: tjm1957
Reviews.Content: 3 star hotel in hte centre of Rome. Surrounded by historical sites and fashionable shops (for those inclined to shop). Carpet in room was tired and worn out, with traffic stains, but room was comfortable and clean. Staff were remarkably friendly and helpful and I cannot fault them.

Reviews.Title: “Great location Clean and friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: NB34
Reviews.Content: Great location on one of the main shopping streets and just around the corner from the Spanish Steps where there is a Metro station. There is also a bus stop very near to the hotel where the Open air tourist buses stop. Many of the tourist attractions are walkable Hotel Staff were extremely helpful and went out of their way to help particularly when i was buying tickets for the Coloseum online (Thanks again Huseyn). They have free internet access in the lobby as well as free Wifi in all of the rooms. Our room was spotlessly clean with good decor , but quite small with limited storage for clothing (only a few drawers) Loads of hangers in the wardrobe though. As we were at the rear of the hotel, there was no noise at all from outside and the air-con which worked well was silent too. Room facilities included a flatscreen TV (no english channels), Hair drier, Safe, Wifi,mini bar/ fridge but had no Tea /coffee making facilities. Breakfast was served on a roof terrace which was quite pleasant but had no view. Continental Breakfast was included in our rate. There is a Lift to all floors except the roof terrace to which, there were just a few stairs. Tip 1 Service at the breakfast room was significantly better towards the end of our stay. I would suggest that if you intend tipping the waitress during your stay, that you do it at the beginning of your stay Tip 2 A small bottle of water can cost 2 euros from street vendors There is a small supermarket (Carrefour express) near to the hotel where you can stock up your room's fridge with drinks relatively cheaply. Go left out of the hotel door, take the first alley on the left and the store is about 100 yards o the left (it's just a hole in the wall so be careful not to miss it) We loved this hotel and would not hesitate to reccomend it to anyone as a base for seeing the sights

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: fly7471
Reviews.Content: It's a shame that previous reviews seem some what distant from the truth. Location is fine and the staff ok but the carpets were dirty and the aircontioning didn't work properly, our room was ridiculously hot and nothing was done when we complained. No proper shower is just disgusting. I'd book somewhere else if I come again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in pedestrian area”
Reviews.Author: nem048
Reviews.Content: Located right on the main shopping area, walking distance to spanish steps etc. New wing of hotel located 100m from main building at no 179, small but modern rooms though no internet reception even though free, quiet at this new area, with no staff in sight. Old tiny lift helps you with your case. Also stayed one night at the main building - rather old & worn with dirty carpet & stuffy room as a/c wasnt working; breakfast was at the small roof terrace -simple choice of toast & cereal. Reception helpful.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: LandJe
Reviews.Content: We've booked this little hotel directly via e-mail contact with reservation-desk/reception, which responded very quick and accurate, Room was clean and nicely furnished, with a good bed. Our bathroom could use some little renovation (f.a. missing plugs in basin and bath, absence of a shower rod), but everything was very clean. Breakfast was good and complete, nice on the roofterrace, between other old buildings.Nice atmosphere in the whole hotel. Free WiFi and very helpfull staff. It is a very nice place to stay, for a fair price, on a good location, when you don't need much luxury. (it is an historical building,so a little noisy maybe, but nothing inconvenient) For sure, we will come back to this hotel. It is a perfect place to explore the historical centre of rome, in one of the biggest shopping streets. Close to Vila Borghese, Trevi Fountain, Spanish stairs etc. Even the Colloseum and Vatican city are within walking distance, otherwise take the subway.

Reviews.Title: “It was great and i would recommend this hotel to friends”
Reviews.Author: PetervanderWel
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in two locations (close to eachother) One location is on Via del corso 117 and the other location is on number 79 which can be usefull information when you book "class house" and visit for the first time. The breakfast is not that great in class house. Better go to the hotel on via del corso 117. All other features of the hotel are great!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff!”
Reviews.Author: RZaz
Reviews.Content: Our second stay at this hotel. Located on the Via del Corso pedestrian area; very clean rooms, great air-conditioning, included a lovely breakfast on the rooftop! Very close to the Spanish Steps & the Piazza del Populo. Our room faced the Via del Corso, but we experienced no outrageous street noise. We slept just fine! Lovely staff, well informed, and very helpful. Emailed them several times before we arrived to ask some questions, and they responded immediately! We wouldn't stay anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Kayla72
Reviews.Content: I travel every month and the Hotel del Corso is a gem - the staff are the kindest and most polite to be found in Rome - the property is clean, fiarly priced and in the best location right on the Via del Corso!

Reviews.Title: “Location and Breakfast is what its all about”
Reviews.Author: xomannycindyxo5
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect and you couldn't get a better breakfast. We actually thought this 3 star breakfast was better than the one we had at a 4 star. Fresh fruit, meat, cheese, pastries, cereal, etc. We arrived very early and our room was just about ready for us. The reviews were right on the money when it comes to noise. Via Del Corso is a busy street. Our room overlooked the street. We had a triple room. There was a band playing right outside the window on the street till who knows what time -- the sleeping pill and ear plugs do wonders. Honestly if you aren't used to city street noise don't travel without ear plugs because all our hotels had street noise but no band.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice”
Reviews.Author: Geekguy1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel del Corso (website is www.hoteldelcorsoroma.com), based on location (near the Spanish Steps) and reviews. The reviews were on target, because we found the hotel's location perfect, the rooms relatively large (for Europe), clean, and with a staff that could not be more helpful. The downside is that our room faced the Via del Corso, which made it pretty noisy until between midnight and 1 AM or so. The included breakfast was also better than the standard continental, with fruit, yogurt, hard boiled eggs, and excellent cappuccino. Internet service was also available.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Natasha1920
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for a period of 4 nights in November 2010. This was in the new part of the hotel (Class House). I cannot fault the hotel or it's staff, they were friendly and helpful. The room I had was a double and it was great, clean and a very good size. There was on incidence of not having a great night sleep but that was due to the traveller's in the room next door and not the fault of the hotel. The location of the hotel is perfect - its in a buzzing area with plenty of places to visit and explore. Lots of places to eat and relax right on the doorstep. In terms of a base for touring Rome, this hotel is perfect. I did not need to get a bus, train or cab anywhere. If you don't mind walking then this is the perfect base from which to walk and explore what Rome has to offer. I would not hesitate to stay here again and will definitely recommend the hotel to my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but otherwise lacking.”
Reviews.Author: landlocked29
Reviews.Content: The Good: 1. Good location within walking distance of many sites. 2. Clean. 3. Staff speaks English. The Not so Good: 1. The new part of the hotel is actually several blocks from the original section of the hotel. The website does not accurately convey the distance. 2. For the price, there are better hotels in the area. 3. Issues with maintenance and electronics. 4. Loud cleaning and vacuuming before 8:30 am. All in all not a bad hotel, just not one I would want to stay at again.

Reviews.Title: “What a position”
Reviews.Author: followthefish
Reviews.Content: If you going to stay in Rome and want to be in the centre of it all than Hotel del Corso is the place to be. We stayed in their newly renovated rooms with balconies overlooking Via del Corso, looking to Palazzo de Venezia in one direction and Piazza del Popolo in the other. Walk to the next intersection (30 meters) turn left and you are looking at the Spanish Steps down the end of the street. Everything is all within easy walking distance and at night plenty of restaurants nearby. Close the balcony doors and a peaceful night sleep is the reward after a day of walking. Breakfast on the terrace was great and the staff at breakfast and reception could not be more helpful. We would throughly recommend this hotel and intend to stay there again next time we are in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, good location, nice people”
Reviews.Author: SanneMarith
Reviews.Content: We've stayed 10 nights in Hotel del Corso in Rome. It was a very good experience. The hotel staff was very nice and gave us tips what to do in the city centre. Also the room was cleaned up every morning. The clothes that were on the floor, they picked it up and hang it up. The location was great, you could walk everything. Also the breakfast was very good. A lot of bread, yoghurt, fruit and drinks. We didn't had any problems with the sound on the street. However, it was noisy in the hotel itself. But not irritating. We are very satisfied with this hotel and we definately come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: Ilovepeachs
Reviews.Content: My parents and teenage daughter stayed a total of 5 nights. Four nights when we first arrived to Italy and again on our last night. This hotel has two buildings. The first part we stayed in their very new and very beautiful location that is just a half a block down the street from the lobby. It is very modern and perfect. It was not a bother to walk down to the main hotel for breakfast, it was actually very nice, in the morning the streets are quiet and beautiful. It does look like they are planning on serving breakfast at the new location soon though. The breakfast room is small but not a problem and very nice . The food was great, not over the top but nice. The roof top balcony was also beautiful and quiet, when we were the there the jasmin was in bloom and the smell was incredible. Right outside our hotel is a beautiful church where we went to mass on Sunday. The location is perfect for shopping, restaurants and centraly located for all the site seeing. The staff was very informative and helpful. On our second stay (one night) we stayed at the main building were the style was traditional and the rooms were clean. the rooms were very nice but the walls or connecting door was very thin and I could hear every word our neighbors said, but they were not a problem since they went to sleep about the same time we did. I was very grateful for that since this could have been a problem. If we went to Rome again I would stay here again with out hesitation but would request the new location.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: SaminQ8
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Hotel Del Corso about four or five times now, but we will never stay there again. First of all, yes, the location is excellent and so is the staff. However, they know they have this excellent location, but management has let the hotel get completely rundown. Upon entering, the small lobby and immediate area are fine, as is the small internet space, but once you reach your room, you are very disappointed, at least we were. We stayed for two nights and then returned in two weeks for three more nights. Neither room was better than the other! We could hear street noise from Via Del Corso, and also almost every word our neighbors spoke. One neighbor had a fight and we ended up having to bang on the wall. The bathroom was a disgrace. The shower curtain was old and moldy and needed to be replaced years ago. I almost cut off the bottom of it to send them a "hint". Water got all over the floor and one of the tabs on the sink was broken. The towels are worn and the carpeting in the bedroom was disgustingly stained and looked as though it hadn't be cleaned in ages. A/C didn't work all that well, and since it was August, and extremely hot, we really needed it. We asked for a nicer room when we returned, but it really wasn't much better. The continental breakfast is served on the rooftop during the summer, and it was a joke. The staff could have cared less about us, the quality of the food deplorable and we ended up not even bothering to go up after the second day. Management needs to do something about the quality of this hotel. It is barely a one star now in our estimation. It used to be perfect, and even though it has a great location, there are so many other hotels in the immediate area, for possibly a little bit more money, that would be much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic hotel, good location, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: vissi87
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hotel Del Corso for 3 nights during our recent trip to Rome. The entrance of the hotel was very attractive and staff was very friendly and helpful. We arrived very early in the morning and were told our room wasn’t ready yet so we walked around the entire city of Rome and didn’t return until about 6:30 in the evening! There was so much to see. The location of the hotel is perfect. It’s only a short walk to the Spanish steps and walking distance to most other tourist sites around the city. The area it’s situated in is a very classy shopping area with many exclusive boutique shops nearby such as Versace, Fendi, Gucci, Prada, Bulgari and many more. Our room was located on the 3rd floor with a nice view over Via Del Corso. The room itself was very small with a bed, a desk and not much else, however it was quite attractively decorated. The bathroom was tiny and cramped but was fitted out with marble and looked quite nice. The bed wasn’t very comfortable at all and the pillows were flat but we were so tired after walking around the city all day that we slept well anyway. There wasn’t much in terms service or luxury but we understood that prior to booking as the main reason we chose to stay here was due to the central location. Breakfast was complimentary every morning and though basic, it was very nice. The breakfast room was gorgeous complete with an old fireplace, wooden flooring and cute little tables and chairs. It felt like we were having breakfast in an intimate guesthouse as opposed to a hotel. The breakfast items included choice of coffee or orange juice, cling peaches, yoghurt, fresh bread rolls, brioche, croissants and Italian cornetti (small croissants filled with either jam or custard and dusted with icing sugar) and a variety of mini jam, butter and nutella sachets. Overall our stay at Hotel Del Corso was pleasant. All the staff members we came into contact with were very friendly and the location was fantastic. I would recommend Hotel Del Corso to people who are looking for decent accommodation in a very central location.

Reviews.Title: “never stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: pumpui
Reviews.Content: we booked this hotel for 9 nights and realized that made a big mistake when we checked in. NOISE,NOISE, NOISE - 24 hours , esp at 6-30 in the morning. We could hear every sound from the next room and it was impossible to sleep well. Plus , bathroom was broken and room was not really clean. After 4 days of having non sleep nights we moved out of this place. Hotel's staff was really good and friendly that I should say.

Reviews.Title: “Worst $350.00 per night hotel ever! AWFUL”
Reviews.Author: sbscuba
Reviews.Content: Dirty upholstry, wood floor popping up, mold 10" up the shower curtain, wallpaper was falling off the wall. No TV service of any kind in our room. Breakfast was awful, nothing of any nutritional value, tiny breakfast room. We would never recommend this hotel to anyone. Travelled all around the world and this is the worst hotel ever, for any price!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, good location”
Reviews.Author: PatfromPa
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Hotel Delcorso 2 nights precruise. Came to the conclusion that this was not a 3 star hotel more like at 2 star and although the location could not be beat( by the Spanish Steps), still feel I paid way too much for these accomendations. Had a triple and a double. The triple was ready on check in so 5 of us put allthe luggage in this room. Bathroom was very small, no vanity just a sink no where to put toiletries, and there were 2 single beds together and a cot ( not a bed). Air conditioner was almost non existant and it was very hot in Rome, so room was uncomfortable. Double room was much nicer, large vanity and nice decor. complimentary breakfast was a joke, bowls were so small for the cereal lucky if it held 2 tablespoons of cereal, Juice was unrecognizable,very pale yellow, terrible taste. hard boiled eggs, danish and crossaints (decent), lunch meat( it is Europe) coffee was served by an attendent. Again this was served on the roof top terrace, sounds nice however it was hot hot hot in Rome so if you like looking at tiled roof tops in 88 degree weather , the terrace is for you. The hotel reception team were very nice and helpful, as I stated before the location can not be beat, but for the money I think I could have found a better hotel. I will not return if I go to Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Grubby and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Pov333
Reviews.Content: Although I doubt any non-Italian speakers will book into this hotel, I wanted to make sure if you do there is no illusion. This was no doubt once a lovely hotel and the location off the via del corso is superb but it is now well past it's best. We entered a room on a the third floor and was hit by a stale repellent smell, which my husband classed as "armpit". The rooms was filthy - greasy yellow netting hung limply at the window, stained sofa and worktop, cracked bathroom. We didn't know where to put our clothes down safely. The lamp switches were brown with dirt and greasy. In the end we slept on top of the bed not wanting to venture under the sheets. There was no aircon, although we did have to wash our hands after pressing the buttons in a vain attempt to get it to function (it was also dirty). We stayed because friends were staying in the same hotel and it was just for one night. This place is vastly overpriced - I would recommend staying somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Del Corso Hotel is Lovely”
Reviews.Author: peanut7h
Reviews.Content: Hello. I stayed at Hotel del Corso in Rome after a cruise in May 2007. Here is my honest feedback: Pros -very friendly staff -great breakfast/cute dining room -beautiful beautiful beautiful -best possible location for the price, you are close to everything -Ease of check in and check out -Fabulous accomodations, bed great -The front desk person checked the flight departure time for us on his computer! Cons -AC didn't work, we couldn't get anyone to fix it, we opened up the window which worked fine so we didn't make a big deal about the AC not working. At night though, it was sooooooooooooo loud outside having the window open. Couldn't close the window because it was way too hot in the room. If I would have had ear plugs it would have been perfect. -Safe didn't work, tried to get someone to come up and fix it but nobody did. That was ok though, the nice guy at the front desk put our passports in his safe while we were out of the room.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star That’s Not Even a Two Star”
Reviews.Author: Cloud9west
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel directly through them because of good reviews and the web site. Upon entering the hotel, you think it will live up to its web site. We had booked 6 nights, requested a back courtyard room and were told “this is one of our best rooms.” We were handed a room key that was connected to a piece of cardboard wrapped in duct tape – that was the first clue. The room was large, yes, but filthy – wallpaper peeling off the walls, holes in the bedding, the carpet very stained and dirty (with what appeared to be a large stain where a dog lifted its leg on the corner of the bed), the mattress was like sleeping on a noisy box spring, the bathroom spattered with mold that smelled and some ancient shower hardware that looked like an old fashioned telephone receiver that you had to hold to bathe yourself. In short, disgusting. As far as amenities, this hotel has very little – no ice, no internet, no laundry service. Their breakfast is very small and very stale and old (the juice had a scum floating on the top that was more than simply pulp and untouched the three days we were there). We saw a couple of fellow travelers our first morning and asked how their room was – the expression on the woman’s face said it all. She said they had a barking dog next to them the previous couple of nights and that their room was also in bad shape. They were leaving that day and glad to be gone. The location (4 blocks from the Spanish Steps) is probably why such a horrible hotel was priced at 150 Euros per night, but it was not worth it. There was little in the way of places to eat or go at night (since it is mostly stores in the area), thus rendering the location useless.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but pricey”
Reviews.Author: AlliLane1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with another couple and had a great few days in Rome because the location was really central to everything. The room was small however, even though we had reserved a suite for all 4 of us. It probably isnt any different though from other hotels in its class in Rome -- we weren't expecting a huge American hotel. Rome is pretty pricey, so for $300 a night we were paying for the location. They had a nice breakfast in the morning and the staff was super helpful and very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: HenryHippo07
Reviews.Content: The Hotel del Corso's location is perfect for a tourist in Rome. The Spanish steps and Trevi fountain are just a few blocks away, and we were able to walk 20-25 minutes to the Vatican, Coloseum, and Pantheon. The hotel rooms were nicely appointed, clean and rather spacious for Rome. The rooftop breakfast was not the best we had on our trip, but they do make a good cappuchino! We would recommend the del Corso for anyone hoping to see all of the sites in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: akcMelbourne
Reviews.Content: this hotel really is in a fantastic location! we only stayed one night but glad we picked somewhere so central. the hotel itself isnt that great, teh rooms arent that nice, although they are clean and you feel safe. the breakfast is average. we had a room on the first floor which was above a shop and so we had music and noise from the shop in our room which was quite annoying. Wouldnt stay here for a longer than one night trip in rome, but for the one night it was great because so easy to see all the rome sights.

Reviews.Title: “Not nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: s00n2bwed
Reviews.Content: Booked a quad room and was told it would have two queen beds. However, upon arriving found one queen and one pull out. Also, the pull out was broken and there was a valley eunning down the middle of the bed making it unsleepable. In our room, the A/C was not working and the bathroom was not clean. The carpet looked old and very dirty and the room in general had a fowl odor. When we asked the only person working at the hotel if anything could be done he said "No, we could get a fan!" We asked for a different room and he said they were full. We then asked if he knew of any other hotels and we were told that all of Rome is booked. Lucky for us we had family which was staying at a differnt location in Rome and we were able to get a room there. We ended up staying at the Fellini B&B, which was nice, very clean, and charged a reasonable rate. The Fellini was located close to the Del Corsa, which is probably the only good thing we could say about the Del Corsa is that it is in a great area. I would not recommend staying at the Del Corsa, better hotels exist and Rome is not booked!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but....”
Reviews.Author: PoofsOnTour
Reviews.Content: OK, so Hotel Del Corso is on probably the most famous shopping street in Rome, it also is within walking distance to many of the big attractions such as the Trevi Fountain, Spanish Steps and Pantheon. So, location wise it is brilliant, which is very much reflected in the pricing...quite costly. The rooms are all disappointingly small and dark for the money, however the street-side rooms seem to be more light and airy. Our room lacked a few necessities such as a proper shower (hand shower only), a bathplug, no coffee making and unpredictable air conditioning. Staff were a mixed bag, with one being marvellous and helpful, the other being somewhat surly/ On a brighter note, there is a lovely rooftop garden where breakfast is served and again, the location is fantastic....we just didnt see the value.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: beeklie
Reviews.Content: Del Corso was a great place to stay. It was very close to the buslines and the metro lines as well as being on the main street in Rome ( Via del Corso). The staff was extremely helpful. The room was very clean and the bed was also very comfortable. The hotel had a problem with their hot water and needed to be turned on about 10 minutes before you shower.

Reviews.Title: “Awful Room”
Reviews.Author: Carl100
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel! Excellent location, but terrible rooms and service (the pictures shown on its website are deceiving). The driver sent by the hotel for airport pickup was late and we had to call the hotel twice to find out if he was indeed coming. Our room was not ready until late afternoon and when we finally saw it we were deeply disappointed. It was small and dark, the bathtub had black mold all over, the hair dryer was broken, and everything else seemed to be in disrepair. We found another hotel room nearby and tried to move but didn't because we would be charged for the first night if we left. Breakfast was meager and not up to a typical Italian hotel's standards (this was our 12th trip to Italy). We would never even consider staying at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been better”
Reviews.Author: bluestarr
Reviews.Content: Went to this hotel for a wedding. The service was ok. They twice forgot to wake members of our party for taxis to the airport when we were going home. Breakfast was on the roof which was beautiful but did not tell us when it was raining that breakfast was inside. If you did not get down before 8 o'clock you did not get much choice of food. The rooms were ok. The safe was not working. The toilet flooded the room. At night you could hear the air conditioner and sleep was difficult. Apart from that the location is perfect. Right in the heart of shopping land and not far from main areas. You get a bus to the Vatican but I would prefer Hotel del Corso location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: greve
Reviews.Content: Location first rate. Able to walk to most of the tourist attractions. Good breakfast, although the rooftop garden was closed. Room was very nice, although tiny (to be expected, so we were not disappointed). Only drawback we had was that our room was on the first floor and the window looked into a light-well. I say lightwell, but in fact at our level there was very little light, it was like a murky cave. Having said this, we decided we were only going to sleep in the room and it was very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “good one”
Reviews.Author: senrab
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 and stayed at the hotel del corso on the 3.7.2006 The room was well appointed,the airconditioning worked all night, handy seeing it had been 37c Excellent bathroom The staff could not have been more helpful, and the location was perfect for a short stay. Not the cheapest in town, but great value for what you get Would definately stay there again. Barnes family n.s.w Australia

Reviews.Title: “Hated every moment”
Reviews.Author: Meemers333
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Del Corso for 3 nights as part of our honeymoon (for $257US/night). This was the fifth European hotel that we stayed at and it was horrible. I can honestly say that it is worse than staying at a motel in the US. But there were two things going for the hotel: the staff were extremely friendly and the location was perfect. The stay was so bad that we had a different room every night we stayed there. For the first night, we stayed in room 308. The room was so small that we didn't even have room to put down our luggage. The shower was so moldy that even the shower curtain was almost black. I started to have asthma attacks from the mold (which is why we asked for a new room). Also, it was as though the room was split into two with a door separating the two rooms. I know that there are hotel rooms that have a separating door but this was ridiculous....we would even hear our next door neighbors sneeze and cough as thought they were in the same exact room as us!!! Also, the window is a window to the hall so you cannot even open the drapes for some sunshine without having other guests walk right by your room. For the second night, we stayed in room 106. This room was a lot better than the previous room but the AC didn't work at first. We had privacy for once but the window situation was the same. Instead of a bath tub we had an extremely small shower stall but, at least, it was free of mold. Also, there was gum on the phone, our phone didn't work, and we actually had to ask for toilet paper as the housekeeper did not replenish our supply. We ended up leaving this room only because our AC did end up breaking and we sweated it out for early part of the night (it was ~34 degrees Celsius in Rome). For the third night, we stayed in room 302. Because it was in the middle of the night that we had to ask for the room, we ended up getting a small bed since the room was for 1 person. Believe it or not, this room was actually nicer than the first two. None of the rooms we stayed at looked anything like the pictures they had advertised. Neither my husband or I have ever stayed at any hotel that looked like this place. It was dark, dingy, dirty and musky-smelling. The hotel was so cheap that every single light only had 1 bulb instead of both bulbs in them....so our rooms always looked dim and dingy. I'm almost glad that this was the last hotel we stayed at for our honeymoon because it actually got to a point where I cried that this was how I was going to remember how I ended my last few days of my honeymoon. I would never ever recommend to anyone to stay at this hotel. That it why I've found it extremely important to write this review.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: DG&JM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our Honeymoon and had a great experience. The staff was fabulous and helped out with restaurant recommendations. The rooms were clean and we had a private bathroom. My husband loved that they had a towel warmer. The complementary breakfast was a great way to start the day. We would absolutely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: ellie01473
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great find. The location is great for seeing the sights... within easy walking distance of the Spanish Steps and the Trevi, with other sights such as the Vatican and Colosseum a but further afield, but still accessible by foot. All I would say was that it was not the easiest of places to find... tucked in between rows of shops! The hotel itself was very pleasant. It was clean and the staff were friendly and helpful. The room we had was quite small but it was well decorated and more than adequate as very little time was spent inside! As other reviews have mentionned, the walls were thin and you could hear some noise from the adjoining room, but it was not that bad. The breakfast that was included in the price was quite basic - very little choice, but it served its purpose.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Posher1
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Rome and had read some horror stories for hotels. We booked this hotel after checking out this site for reviews. This hotel has 3 stars but by english standards, should have more. It is spotlessly clean and the rooms are really well decorated and confortable. The hotel is about 5 mins walk from the Spanish and more importantly the Spanish Steps metro system where you can visit the whole of Rome for 4 euros per day. The only negative thing that I can say is that it is on main street and can be noisy. We were ther in the winter so the double glazing took care of that but could be a problem in the summer. Overall great location and I would definately go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: gmsp
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Del Corso for 6 nights at end October. Throughout our stay the staff could not have been more helpful. Breakfast was basic but plentiful and delicious. Our room was clean and functional although it had no view, overlooking an internal courtyard. The plus point here though was that we suffered no traffic noise. Location could not be bettered being within easy walking distance of Spanish Steps & Trevi Fountain etc with many good restaurants in vicinity. Met by car arranged by hotel (48 euros), driver courteous and even detoured past several sights on way in which was nice. Would definitely choose this hotel if in Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: OzzieCritter
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night to end our visit to Rome on a high and we weren't disappointed. We are a family of 4 and paid 250 euros which is expensive but normal for central Rome. Via Del Corso was alive and vibrant on Saturday afternoon when we arrived but none of this could be heard inside our fantastic room. It was really 2 rooms with a king bed and double bed for the kids and looked out over the Via Del Corso. It was clean and well decorated in typical O.T.T. italian style. Yes the breakfast is basic consisting of cereal and lovely fresh pastries but what more do you want. I have to thank the desk staff who helped us out Sunday morning when our booked transport did not arrive, making 2 phone calls and then booking a taxi for us to the airport. If you are an early riser I would recommend going for an early morning walk. We forgot about the time change and consequently were ready an hour early. Walking through an empty, peaceful Rome is pretty special, especially seeing the St Peters dome in a golden glow and reflected in the river.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid....if you possibly can.”
Reviews.Author: FoggMurphys
Reviews.Content: We had difficulty find a hotel in Rome as October is a busy month. Unfortunately we found this one through Michelin. It's in a nice location but is cheerless and scruffy. Our room was a large high ceilinged room which had been chopped in half with a bathroom inserted. It was very curious and the decoration was way over the top but scuffed and scruffy. A friend had a single room which had no outside window - only a window onto an internal corridor - and the curtain hanging off its track. There was mould around both baths, which were of the cheapest plastic, carpets were stained and wallpaper was nicked and peeling. Breakfast was very basic. If you can find nothing else in Rome, you may care to stay here as Rome is such a fantastic city, but it's not a good hotel and the prices are high.

Reviews.Title: “OK Hotel in Great Location...but get your own ride from airport to hotel”
Reviews.Author: ladybrooke
Reviews.Content: Prior to our trip, I had arranged with the Hotel del Corso to provide us with transportation from the airport to the hotel. I was initially very impressed with their courtesy and prompt replies to my emails. I informed them that we would not have a cell phone with us; however, we would contact them via a payphone if we were unable to find the driver at the airport. As it turned out, Rome was fogged in when we arrived, and would not allow planes to land for 2 hours, so we had to fly to Milan to refuel. which added another 80 minutes to the trip. When we arrived at the airport, the driver was nowhere to be found. My husband purchased a 20 Euro phone card and called the hotel. The receptionist said that the driver went to the airport, waited for a few minutes then left. He said he would send another driver. We waited over an hour...no one showed. We called the hotel again, were put on hold and were told the driver was on his way. The hotel had given us strict instructions not to talk to any of the drivers in the airport because they would rip us off, but we were at our wits end having waited for the hotel's driver for over 2 hours! Some of the drivers at the airport quoted us 90 Euro, since it was a holiday... I finally went to the airport's information desk. The attendant called the Hotel del Corso and was told that the driver was not coming! I called the Hotel del Corso once gain and the receptionist said, "Just take a taxi!" I said that the drivers were charging 90 Euros....then the 20 Euro phone card ran out! I have never been more aggravated in my entire life! After a heated discussion, we decided to attempt taking the subway to the hotel. On our way to the subway's escalator, we were stopped by a driver who said he would charge us 40 euro for a ride to the hotel...he claimed it would be cheaper than the subway.... We took him up on his offer...ended up saving 9 Euro off the Hotel del Corso's car service. I was fearful that there would be some sort of timeshare offer or other trap... since the Hotel del Corso had warned us that these drivers were all thieves... but totally gave up because I couldn't take any more. Thankfully, there was no trap. In a nutshell....it is inexcusable that a hotel in the "elite" part of town (del Corso) would abandon their clients. Since Rome is near water, it is safe to assume that it often is fogged in. Consequently, a hotel or car service should contact the airport to check on the conditions/flight time and not leave their clients stranded. Despite the transportation woes, the hotel itself is in a very convenient area. Other staff members we encountered were pleasant, and the email correspondence with the hotel was pleasant/efficient. The appearance of our room was true to the pictures on tripadvisor.com and other websites and was clean. It was certainly in a very convenient part of the city. If it weren't for our disasterous car accommodation incident and no apology from the receptionist once we arrived (nor were we informed about breakfast), I would have given the Hotel del Corso a decent review, since they are in an excellent area, the room was clean, but the walls were a bit banged up. We would consider staying there again, since the hotel is in such a convenient location, but would arrange for our own transport to the hotel through the airport shuttle service, which is cheaper and, in our case, more reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Super small hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelguru
Reviews.Content: This lovely 3 star hotel is ideally located near the Spanish Steps and within walking distance of most of Rome's tourist attractions. We walked to Piazza Navona via Pantheon, returning via trevi fountain and spanish steps almost every night. On a nice pedestrian street full of shops and lots of trattorias and bars on the streets just off makes it an ideal place to stroll round. Rooms are very clean with nice new bathrooms and our quad suite was suprisingly spacious. No noise what so ever from other rooms or from street outside. Good aircon kept room cool and minibar keeps your drinks and chocolate cool too. Stayed for 7 nights and really enjoyed staying here. As mentioned in previous posts, front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Breakfast on roof terrace had everything you need to start the day. Our requirements for a family of 4 were a centrally located hotel within walking distance of most sites, clean spacious room, friendly staff, good breakfast and at a good price (190 euros). This hotel got a tick in every box and we would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “We couldnt have asked for a better hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hayley81
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 3 days in Rome and could not have stayed at a better hotel. The staff were very friendly and helpful and our room was fantasic,very clean and spacious, it had air conditionng and had a lovely bathroom. The location was brilliant,we were in walking distance for everything. The roof terrace is nice and there are lots of lovely little restaurants and cafes around the hotel all with very friendly staff. We had an absolutely fantasic time and would reconmend this hotel to anyone travelling to rome for its location, price and service. Have a nice holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Del Corso”
Reviews.Author: andy1961
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Del Corso after reading Trip Advisor. What a great hotel. The staff all spoke very good english and the location was unbelievable. You're around a three minute walk to the Spanish Steps and the shopping in the area is fantastic. We had a quad room with a King and a pull out coach. Nice and clean with decent air conditioning. Just a note to look for 'air conditioning' and not 'temperature controlled' if you're sourcing hotel rooms. Temperature controlled usually means a fan. Typical breakfast included on a beautiful roof top terrace. This was also a nice place to relax and crack a bottle of wine after a long day of touring. Within several feet of the hotel on either side you have wonderful bistros. One has awesome pizza, the other has ice cream and wine. The staff also arranged pick-up to and from the airport and also to and from Citavecchia at a great price. I would highly recommend this hotel for the location, service and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service from the front desk staff of this charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been recently renovated, and our room, though small, was nicely appointed. The air conditioning functioned well, and most important, when the window was closed, the room was completely soundproof with regard to the considerable street noise. We loved the location, close as it is to the heart of Rome, and we walked eveywhere. The concierges were extremely helpful - we had had a bag stolen which contained both of our airline tickets and one of our passports. The staff were not only sympathetic, they also did all of the phoning necessary to find out what our next steps were, gave us directions to the embassy, spoke to the airline on our behalf and even called back to Tuscany for us, all at no charge for phone calls, and all done very willingly. The little roof garden, where an excellent breakfast is served, is charming, and in the evening, very often unused - a great place for a nightcap. I would stay here again, and recommend it to anyone

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: i_dr
Reviews.Content: Was in Rome for the first time recently and stayed in this hotel for three nights. Picked this hotel primarily because of its location and I wasn't disappointed. Our family of four was given a good sized room that opened to Via del Corso. Wasn't bothered by the noise at all. People at the reception spoke good english and were very helpful. I only have three complaints: 1) The price for the room was I think a bit steep compared to similarly-classed hotels in other European cities; but I guess is par for those in Rome. 2) Pass on an offer by the staff to get a van to bring you to the airport. Get a cab instead. Paid EUR 75.00 for the van while a cab would only cost EUR 40.00+. 3) Breakfast could be a lot better.

Reviews.Title: “very good small hotel with excellent location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in early April 2005. The room was smallish but fine for our family of 4. The room and bathroom were very clean. The room we were in did not have any sort of view but we were only in the room to sleep anyway. We had no problem with any excessive noise from other rooms. The front desk staff spoke very good English and were very helpful in arranging for taxis and for a car to the airport. The breakfast was good althought the breakfast room is on the small side. The location for this hotel is excellent. We were able to walk to most places and,if needed, the metro is only 2 blocks away. The area outside the hotel is a "pedestrian only" area so that was nice as well. We would definately stay at this hotel again if we are lucky enough to return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Del Corso in early November 2004 and had a great holiday. The room, although small, had everything we needed and the staff were very helpful. The hotel is in a great spot and we were able to walk to most places including great restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Bring ear plugs to Hotel del Corso”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for three nights. The worst thing about the hotel is the soundproofing, we could hear "everything" the couple in the next bedroom got up to, as if they were in our room. The bedroom was tiny, it was difficult to pass each other in the bedroom. The view from our bedroom was on to a "chimney" of backs of other buildings covered by pipes etc. You had to put your head right out the window and look straight up past three floors in order to see the sky. Staff were very helpful. Location was great.

Reviews.Title: “Noise Noise Noise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: They cut the walls when they remodeled. The rooms are small and very noisey.Not the cleanest place in the world. Coffee machine was broken at breakfast. Would look for a real hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: kajfish
Reviews.Content: The Hotel del Corso was in a fantastic location within easy walking distance of all major sights. Our room was the smallest room we had ever stayed in, and we travel a lot! Having said that it was spotlessly clean and we didn't spend much time in it with all those wonderful places to visit! Fine for a short break, but we wouldn't want to stay in a room that small for any great length of time.

Reviews.Title: “Location! Location! Location!”
Reviews.Author: Moms-Trip
Reviews.Content: After reviewing all 832 hotels etc. in Rome, I took the advise of an Air Canada agent who said if you are going to Rome to shop....check out the Via del Corso, so naturally that brought me to this quaint little 18 room boutique hotel ON the Via del Corso. After many emails to Allesandro at the front desk, we agreed that I could have a balcony, and a shower, I was pleasantly surprised to find a bath tub as well. I think there are only 2 balconies in the hotel, and they are really small, but you have these wonderful doors that open to the street, and 4 of us were able to stand there and enjoy the traffic, foot and taxis, in this fabulous spot. The room had obviously been updated, hardwood flooring, bedding, draperies were lovely! Minutes from the Spanish Steps, the Colliseum, 10 minutes from the Vatican, you cannot beat the location. Shopping and restaurants in the area were fabulous! We were only in Rome for 2 days so had to make the most of it, and we certainly did. The breakfast was fine, and the rooms really were lovely! What you save on taxis you can spend on the hotel per night. Check out some of the others in the area and this was really a deal at 180E per night for 2 persons. I booked directly with the hotel via email. The roof garden is closed November 1, due to fall weather so we ate in a small diningroom and never got to use the garden. The front desk is more than helpful. We would definitly stay in this property again, without hesitation!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: travel2020
Reviews.Content: This hotel was located right in the heart of some great shopping. The Spanish Steps were only minutes away. The rooms were small, but all hotel rooms in Europe are small. It was clean and decorated very nicely. The staff was friendly and helpful. The rate was high, but not as high as some of the other hotels in this particular area. It was definately worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The best in Rome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Del Corso is excellent! The location of this hotel cannot be beat. Excellent surroundings, superb staff, unbeatable breakfast, comfortable rooms..... I could go on and on. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and we will not consider ever staying anywhere else in Rome from now on. I would recommend this hotel to anyone going to Rome. Thanks for a great stay.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Del Corso
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Corso 79, 00186 Rome, Italy
